doc.previous: The original diagram might be either or depending on the chosen crossing s configuration Then the Alexander Conway polynomial C z is recursively defined according to the rules
doc.after: The second rule is what is often referred to as a skein relation To check that these rules give an invariant of an oriented link one should determine that the polynomial does not change under the three Reidemeister moves Many important knot polynomials can be defined in this way
